# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function that wraps a string to a specified text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        if isempty(current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line = current_line * " " * word 
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

To demonstrate:

```julia
text = "This is a test string that will be wrapped to a text width"
wrapped = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped)
```

Outputs:

```
This is a 
test string 
that will be
wrapped to a
text width
```

The key aspects:

- Split text into words 
- Keep track of current line length
- Start new line when text width exceeded
- Build up lines array and join at the end
